image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

items.synopsis: New research shows more than 25 per cent of homes sold in Queensland, Victoria and NSW were paid for in cash by older Australians who have benefited from high property prices and are "basically immune" to the effects of rising interest rates.

title.children: With another interest rate rise, there's a large group of home buyers who are 'immune' from its impacts

image.altText: A woman steps into an old, dimly lit hallway.

items.synopsis: The state forced Katelyn apart from her mother, who has dementia, for two years. She says her mother was left without important medical care as her guardian struggled to manage an excessive workload.

title.children: Ava's heart monitor was disconnected for more than 18 months. She was under state care the entire time

image.altText: a man cuddles his dog in the doorway of his home

items.synopsis: Jukka is pain-free for the first time in 30 years thanks to medicinal cannabis, but the cost of treatments is crippling him financially.

title.children: 'It keeps me pain-free,' but the cost of medical marijuana is hurting patients

image.altText: Wells smiles as she holds an elderly womans hand and listens to her speak.

items.synopsis: The aged care minister leaves the door open for wealthy people to fund their own aged care, or imposing a levy on Australians to pay for rising costs, as baby boomers begin to enter the system.

title.children: 'The boomers are coming': Aged care minister leaves door open for levy for ageing Australia

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Philip Lowe.

items.synopsis: It's not just stretched borrowers being pushed closer to breaking point. The consensus between the treasurer and the RBA governor is also cracking – at least when it comes to the impact wages are having on inflation, writes David Speers.

title.children: This week's interest rate rise has exposed cracks in the consensus between Chalmers and Lowe

image.altText: Travis Head raises his hands and bat

items.synopsis: Travis Head's fluid century helps Australia into a dominant position after being asked to bat on day one of the ICC World Test Championship Final at the Oval.

title.children: Head century helps Australia dominate opening day of World Test Championship final

image.altText: Before and after images show the flood damage

items.synopsis: Satellite images show the extent of the damage as one of the biggest reservoirs of water in the world drains across war-ravaged Ukraine.

title.children: A flood of biblical proportions: Southern Ukraine will be inundated with 36 Sydney Harbours in days

image.altText: Vladimir Putin chairs meeting

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says the destruction of the Kakhovka dam is an "environmental and humanitarian catastrophe" during a call with Turkish counterpart Tayyip Erdogan.

title.children: Putin calls dam breach a 'catastrophe', Ukraine says it's made advances in Bakhmut

image.altText: A RAAF F/A-18 taxis on a runway in Katherine.

items.synopsis: Kyiv assures the White House that it would not deploy second-hand Australian warplanes into Russian airspace if dozens of the retired F/A-18s are transferred to Ukraine.

title.children: Retired Australian fighter jets a step closer to joining Ukraine's war effort, but obstacles remain

image.altText: Harry and Chelsy

items.synopsis: Giving evidence for the second day in court, Prince Harry says he found a tracking device on the car of former girlfriend Chelsy Davy.

title.children: Prince Harry says he found a tracker on Chelsy Davy's car during press storm

image.altText: An elderly married couple warmly embrace while smiling.

items.synopsis: As a GP, Dion Manthorpe looked after South Australian communities for decades. The 95-year-old was battling cancer when he started to access the state's voluntary assisted dying scheme.

title.children: After caring for people for most of his life, Dion was 95 when he accessed voluntary assisted dying

image.altText: A man standing next to a metal fence on vacant land

items.synopsis: Victorians who have fallen through the cracks in the wake of the Porter Davis collapse are calling for the government to include them in a $15 million insurance scheme.

title.children: 'I can't walk away from $18,000': Collapsed home builder customers barred from compensation scheme

image.altText: A man wearing all black walks along a line of other men, also wearing black.

items.synopsis: The federal government says it will introduce legislation to ban Nazi symbols and the sale of goods-for-profit featuring Nazi symbols.

title.children: Federal government set to introduce national ban on Nazi symbols

image.altText: An Indigenous flag flaps in the wind against a blue sky background

items.synopsis: First Nations patients are more likely to miss medical appointments and be discharged from hospital against medical advice, according to the Queensland Audit Office.

title.children: Queensland will not meet 2031 deadline to close the gap on First Nations life expectancy, report finds

image.altText: A picture of different apps on a phone including ChatGPT

items.synopsis: Scientific papers could be the next ChatGPT battleground. Now researchers say they've developed a tool that is up to 99 per cent accurate at detecting when it's used.

title.children: New ChatGPT-detector 'most accurate yet' say scientists. But will it work in the real world?

image.altText: Performers taking part in an art show.

items.synopsis: The latest "blatant agenda to bring hell to earth" in sleepy old Hobart is about to kick off — and, true to form, has timed the pressing of the wowser button to perfection.

title.children: 'Welcome to hell': Dark Mofo shocks its way to free publicity, yet again

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in the House of Representatives

items.synopsis: Peter Dutton denies members of his party deliberately misrepresented the opinions of federal court judges during debate on the constitution alteration bill on an Indigenous Voice to Parliament.

title.children: Dutton denies shadow ministers misrepresented federal court judges during Voice debate

image.altText: People standing at a bar looking at the bottles of alcohol.

items.synopsis: There are reports coming from all around the country of people being needle and drink spiked. Here's a guide on what to do if you think you're one of them.

title.children: Think you've been spiked? Here's what you should do

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

items.synopsis: Researchers say rising electricity costs are pushing some home owners to replace their solar panels prematurely, increasing the need for bespoke recycling facilities to avoid them going to waste.

title.children: Premature replacement of solar panels polluting landfill driven by rising power costs, researchers warn

image.altText: smiling man holds up pint of lager in pub

items.synopsis: Australians aren't drinking like we used to. Yet, despite parallels to tobacco use, some experts say alcohol's history and place in society mean it'll remain indefinitely.

title.children: Why this expert says we'll always drink, even when we know it's harmful for us

image.altText: Damaged Light fitting inside Lamb House at Kangaroo Point, Brisbane

items.synopsis: It has taken more than two years and the spend has ballooned well beyond the original estimate, but this passion project is almost complete and the owners are excited.

title.children: Two years after buying dilapidated Lamb House, the Wilsons are just months away from moving in

image.altText: A bald man in a suit and red tie speaks into a microphone while siting at a desk in a room decorated with timber.

items.synopsis: Consulting firm KPMG has labelled the behaviour of its competitor PwC disturbing and unacceptable and proposed a list of reforms as part of a Senate inquiry into the integrity of consultants engaged by the federal government.

title.children: 'Sleeping at the wheel': Treasury response to PwC scandal criticised as KPMG proposes reforms

image.altText: A blue sign with white writing on a building that reads "Jenny Craig".

items.synopsis: Jenny Craig's Australian and New Zealand operations will immediately stop trading after administrators failed to find a buyer for the weight-loss company's physical stores.

title.children: Jenny Craig collapses in Australia and New Zealand after no buyer found for weight-loss company

image.altText: Two woman stand next to a sign, one with their hands in the air

items.synopsis: Like Ayers Rock became Uluru, from today Queensland's Fraser Island will officially be known by its Indigenous name, which means paradise.

title.children: 'Long time coming': Queensland's iconic Fraser Island officially named K'gari

image.altText: An athletic man wearing a blue and white striped soccer jersey smiles and windmills his fist in front of a large crowd.

items.synopsis: Lionel Messi will snub a lucrative contract in Saudi Arabia and move to Major League Soccer side Inter Miami as a free agent,  the BBC reports.

title.children: Lionel Messi to join Major League Soccer side Inter Miami after PSG exit, reports say

image.altText: a sign warning about contaminated water

items.synopsis: Children and staff at the schools are being offered bottled water and free blood tests after lead contamination was detected in drinking water supplies.

title.children: 'Understandable concern' as lead detected in drinking water at Far North Queensland schools

image.altText: Man walks on street

items.synopsis: The former NSW Labor minister and convicted paedophile is being treated for multiple injuries after the incident on Tuesday afternoon.

title.children: Disgraced MP Milton Orkopoulos bashed in prison, treated for multiple injuries

image.altText: A large yacht at sea

items.synopsis: A 53.5m luxury superyacht was sold earlier this year to pay back debts to international creditors, but more than $4 million owed to customers is unlikely to be returned.

title.children: Customers are $4 million out of pocket after cruise company collapses

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair smiling at the camera, holding a robotic cat on her lap

items.synopsis: Aged care workers say robotic pets are helping residents reduce anxiety, depression and social isolation.

title.children: Purrs echo around Norma as a robotic cat helps her reconnect

image.altText: Police vehicles and crime scene tape at a home at Narangba, north of Brisbane.

items.synopsis: Shaun Sturgess is on trial for the domestic violence murder of his estranged wife Jacqueline in April 2020.

title.children: Man who 'clubbed' estranged wife over the head with 1.8kg sledgehammer pleads not guilty to murder

image.altText: Pope Francis raises his hand and holds a white book in front of him

items.synopsis: Pope Francis underwent the surgery to repair a hernia in his abdominal wall and is expected to remain at hospital for several days.

title.children: Pope Francis emerges from three-hour abdominal surgery without complications
